intro: Alyxia monticola, commonly known as the mountain alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other related genera. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in woodland or scrub habitats. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and prominent stamens. Alyxia monticola is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaf arrangement, making it distinctive within its native range.
